Title: Works Ministry explains N500m training and equipment budget for artisans
Summary: The Federal Ministry of Works has provided clarity on the proposed expenditure of over N500 million in its 2026 Appropriation Bill . The funds are intended for the training of artisans and provision of equipment such as grinding machines, motorcycles, and mini-vans .

Title: Clarivo Oil plans world-class refinery in Nigeria – CEO, Obidike
Summary: Clarivo Oil and Gas, led by Chief Obidike Chukwuebuka, has announced plans to develop a world-class oil refinery in Calabar, Cross River State . The move is aimed at boosting Nigeria’s downstream oil and gas sector .

Title: Kaduna: Bandits abduct two mothers, son; demand N150m ransom
Summary: Kujama community in Southern Kaduna was thrown into fear on Sunday morning . Armed bandits abducted two women and a nine-year-old boy, leaving behind a three-month-old baby . Bandits demand N150m ransom .

Title: Fashola, Idris, others outline steps to improve Nigeria’s reputation
Summary: Babatunde Fashola SAN called on Nigerians to take deliberate steps in governance, conduct, and public communication to project a positive image of the country . He described this as the first step toward improving Nigeria’s international reputation .

Title: Soludo celebrates Anyaoku at 93
Summary: Governor of Anambra State, Professor Chukwuma Soludo, has congratulated the former Secretary General of the Commonwealth, Chief Emeka Anyaoku, on the occasion of his 93rd birthday .

Title: 2026 World Cup: US opens thousands of new visa slots for Ghanaians
Summary: The U.S. Embassy in Accra has announced the opening of thousands of additional non-immigrant visa appointment slots, many of which are available immediately, in a move aimed at facilitating travel to the United States ahead of the 2026 FIFA World Cup . Title: No delay by top officials, Osun clarifies teacher recruitment process
Summary: Osun State Government has clarified that the issuance of appointment letters to the first batch of newly recruited teachers is ongoing . Spokesperson to the Governor, Olawale Rasheed, dismissed claims that top officials are stalling the process . Media reports suggested that the Head of Service and the Chief of Staff were delaying the exercise over financial considerations

Summary: The Niger State Police Command has arrested six suspects in separate operations across Minna for offences ranging from theft and robbery to criminal conspiracy and thuggery . Title: VIDEO: “Your ₦50k will mean more than her ₦1 million” — Pastor Paul Enenche advises low-earning husbands
Summary: Pastor Paul Enenche has sparked widespread conversation on social media following comments he made on marriage, finances and responsibility . He urged men not to abdicate their responsibilities at home because of income differences . The remarks have since generated mixed reactions online, with many social media users debating financial roles in modern marriages .

Title: Edo owes no allegiance to contractors, only residents — Okpebholo
Summary: Edo State Governor, Monday Okpebholo, declared that the state government does not owe allegiance to any contractor but to the people of the state . He also reaffirmed his administration’s commitment to quality, speed, and accountability in the execution of infrastructure projects .
